title: Getting Started

title: Technical Details
text: vignette provides mathematical computational details joint ODE model implementation.

title: Technical Details
text: State vector: \mathbf{s}_i(t)=(\Lambda_i(t), m_i(t), \dot{m}_i(t))^{\top} \Lambda_i(t) cumulative hazard, m_i(t) biomarker level, \dot{m}_i(t) biomarker velocity. system evolves : \frac{d\mathbf{s}_i}{dt} = \begin{pmatrix} \lambda_i(t|b_i) \\ \dot{m}_i(t) \\ g(\boldsymbol{\beta}^{\top}\mathbf{Z}_i(t)) \end{pmatrix}, \quad \mathbf{s}_i(0) = (0, m_{i0}, \dot{m}_{i0})^{\top} : Hazard: \lambda_i(t|b_i) = \exp[\boldsymbol{\eta}^{\top} \mathbf{B}^{(\lambda)}(t) + \boldsymbol{\alpha}^{\top}\mathbf{m}_i(t) + b_{}+\mathbf{W}_i^{\top}\boldsymbol{\phi}] Acceleration: g(u) = \boldsymbol{\theta}^{\top} \mathbf{B}^{(g)}(u) u = \boldsymbol{\beta}^{\top}\mathbf{Z}_i(t) Features: \mathbf{m}_i(t) = (m_i(t), \dot{m}_i(t), \ddot{m}_i(t))^{\top}, \mathbf{Z}_i(t) = (m_i(t), \dot{m}_i(t), \mathbf{X}_i(t)^{\top}, t)^{\top}

title: Technical Details
text: Parameters: \boldsymbol{\Theta} = (\boldsymbol{\theta}, \boldsymbol{\beta}, \boldsymbol{\eta}, \boldsymbol{\alpha}, \boldsymbol{\phi}, \sigma_e^2, \sigma_b^2) joint likelihood integrates random effects: L_i(\boldsymbol{\Theta}) = \int f(\mathbf{V}_i | b_i) \cdot f(T_i, \delta_i | b_i) \cdot f(b_i) \, db_i Components: Longitudinal: f(\mathbf{V}_i | b_i) = \prod_{j=1}^{n_i} \phi(V_{ij}; m_i(T_{ij}) + b_i, \sigma_e^2) Survival: f(T_i, \delta_i | b_i) = [\lambda_i(T_i|b_i)]^{\delta_i} \exp[-\Lambda_i(T_i|b_i)] Random effect: f(b_i) = \phi(b_i; 0, \sigma_b^2)

title: Technical Details
text: Compute posterior expectations \hat{b}_i = E[b_i|\mathcal{O}_i] \hat{v}_i = \text{Var}[b_i|\mathcal{O}_i]. Q-function decomposes Q(\boldsymbol{\Theta}|\boldsymbol{\Theta}^{(k)}) = Q_L + Q_S + Q_R: Q_L = -\frac{N}{2}\log(2\pi\sigma_e^2) - \frac{1}{2\sigma_e^2}\sum_{,j}[(V_{ij} - m_i(T_{ij}) - \hat{b}_i)^2 + \hat{v}_i] Q_S = \sum_{} \{\delta_i[\log\lambda_i(T_i|0) + \hat{b}_i] - \Lambda_i(T_i|0) \cdot E[e^{b_i}|\mathcal{O}_i]\} Q_R = -\frac{n}{2}\log(2\pi\sigma_b^2) - \frac{1}{2\sigma_b^2}\sum_{}(\hat{b}_i^2 + \hat{v}_i) Key simplification: \log\lambda_i(T_i|b) = \log\lambda_i(T_i|0) + b \Lambda_i(T_i|b) = e^b\Lambda_i(T_i|0) Implementation (subject ): Solve ODE b_i = 0 get m_i(t), \Lambda_i(T_i|0), \log\lambda_i(T_i|0) Find posterior mode \tilde{b}_i maximizing: \ell_i(b) \propto b\left[\frac{S_i}{\sigma_e^2} + \delta_i\right] - \frac{b^2}{2}\left[\frac{n_i}{\sigma_e^2} + \frac{1}{\sigma_b^2}\right] - e^b\Lambda_i(T_i|0) S_i = \sum_j(V_{ij} - m_i(T_{ij})). Newton-Raphson: b \leftarrow b - \nabla_b/H_b \nabla_b = \frac{S_i - n_i b}{\sigma_e^2} + \delta_i - e^b\Lambda_i(T_i|0) - \frac{b}{\sigma_b^2} H_b = -\frac{n_i}{\sigma_e^2} - e^b\Lambda_i(T_i|0) - \frac{1}{\sigma_b^2} Compute posterior moments via Gauss-Hermite quadrature: Points: b_q = \tilde{b}_i + \sqrt{2\tilde{v}_i} x_q \tilde{v}_i = -1/H_b|_{\tilde{b}_i} Weights: w_{iq} \propto w_q \exp[\ell_i(b_q)] (normalized) \hat{b}_i = \sum_q w_{iq} b_q, \hat{v}_i = \sum_q w_{iq}(b_q - \hat{b}_i)^2, E[e^{b_i}|\mathcal{O}_i] = \sum_q w_{iq} e^{b_q}

title: Technical Details
text:
Update parameters maximizing Q( oldsymbol{\Theta}| oldsymbol{\Theta}^{(k)}): Longitudinal ( oldsymbol{	heta},  oldsymbol{ eta}): Minimize \sum_{,j} [V_{ij} - m_i(T_{ij}) - \hat{b}_i]^2 via L-BFGS Measurement variance: \sigma_e^2 =  rac{1}{N}\sum_{,j} [(V_{ij} - m_i(T_{ij}) - \hat{b}_i)^2 + \hat{v}_i] Survival ( oldsymbol{\eta},  oldsymbol{\alpha},  oldsymbol{\phi}): Maximize gradients 
abla_{ oldsymbol{\alpha}} = \sum_i [\delta_i \mathbf{m}_i(T_i) - E[e^{b_i}|\mathcal{O}_i] \int_0^{T_i} \mathbf{m}_i(s)\lambda_i(s|0)ds] 
abla_{ oldsymbol{\eta}} = \sum_i [\delta_i \mathbf{B}^{(\lambda)}(T_i) - E[e^{b_i}|\mathcal{O}_i] \int_0^{T_i} \mathbf{B}^{(\lambda)}(s)\lambda_i(s|0)ds] 
abla_{ oldsymbol{\phi}} = \sum_i [\delta_i \mathbf{W}_i - E[e^{b_i}|\mathcal{O}_i] \cdot \mathbf{W}_i\Lambda_i(T_i|0)] Random effect variance: \sigma_b^2 =  rac{1}{n}\sum_i (\hat{b}_i^2 + \hat{v}_i) Iterate |\mathcal{L}^{(k+1)} - \mathcal{L}^{(k)}|/|\mathcal{L}^{(k)}| < \epsilon.

title: Joint Modeling of Longitudinal and Survival Data Using ODEs
text: JointODE package provides unified framework joint modeling longitudinal biomarker measurements time--event outcomes using ordinary differential equations (ODEs). approach enables simultaneous analysis biomarker trajectories impact survival outcomes.

title: Joint Modeling of Longitudinal and Survival Data Using ODEs
text: observed biomarker measurements modeled : V_{ij}=m_i(T_{ij})+b_i+\varepsilon_{ij},\quad =1,\ldots,n,\quad j=1,\ldots,n_i : V_{ij}: Observed biomarker value subject time T_{ij} m_i(t): True underlying biomarker trajectory b_i\sim\mathcal{N}(0,\sigma_{b}^{2}): Subject-specific random intercept \varepsilon_{ij}\sim\mathcal{N}(0,\sigma_{e}^{2}): Measurement error biomarker trajectory evolution characterized following second-order differential equation: \ddot{m}_i(t) = f\big(m_i(t), \dot{m}_i(t), \mathbf{X}_i(t), t\big) f: \mathbb{R} \times \mathbb{R} \times \mathbb{R}^p \times \mathbb{R}^+ \\mathbb{R} smooth function modeling biomarker acceleration function current value m_i(t), velocity \dot{m}_i(t), time-varying covariates \mathbf{X}_i(t) \\mathbb{R}^p, time t.

title: Joint Modeling of Longitudinal and Survival Data Using ODEs
text: hazard function incorporates biomarker dynamics: \lambda_i(t) = \lambda_{0}(t)\exp\left[\mathbf{m}_i(t)^{\top}\boldsymbol{\alpha}+\mathbf{W}_i^{\top}\boldsymbol{\phi}+b_{}\right] : \lambda_{0}(t): Baseline hazard (e.g., Weibull, piecewise constant) \mathbf{m}_i(t)=\left(m_i(t), \dot{m}_i(t), \ddot{m}_i(t)\right)^{\top}: Biomarker value derivatives \boldsymbol{\alpha}=(\alpha_0, \alpha_1, \alpha_2)^{\top}: Association parameters value, velocity, acceleration \mathbf{W}_i: Baseline covariates coefficients \boldsymbol{\phi} b_i: Subject-specific random intercept detailed mathematical derivations including ODE formulation, likelihood construction, EM algorithm specifics, see technical documentation.

title: Configure B-Spline Parameters — .get_spline_config
text: x Numeric vector data points determining knot positions. Used calculate quantiles knot_placement = "quantile". degree Integer specifying polynomial degree B-spline basis. Common choices: 1 (linear), 2 (quadratic), 3 (cubic). Default 3. n_knots Integer specifying number internal knots. knots allow greater flexibility may cause overfitting. Default 5. knot_placement Character string specifying knot placement strategy: "quantile": Places knots data quantiles (default) "equal": Places knots equal intervals boundary_knots Numeric vector length 2 specifying boundary knots [min, max], NULL use range(x). Default NULL.

title: Configure B-Spline Parameters — .get_spline_config

title: Configure B-Spline Parameters — .get_spline_config
text: function calculates B-spline basis parameters following conventions splines::bs(). degrees freedom equals length(knots) + degree + 1, determines number basis functions resulting B-spline representation.

title: Configure B-Spline Parameters — .get_spline_config

title: Solve Joint ODE System — .solve_joint_ode
text: Solves ODE system governing biomarker trajectories cumulative hazard joint models. Computes dynamics without random effects efficiency, added post-computation.

title: Solve Joint ODE System — .solve_joint_ode
text: params list containing necessary model components: data Subject-specific data components: time: Event/censoring time status: Event indicator (0/1) covariates: Baseline covariates survival model longitudinal: List times, measurements, covariates coef Model coefficients: baseline: B-spline coefficients baseline hazard hazard: Coefficients \([\alpha_m, \alpha_{\dot{m}}, \alpha_{\ddot{m}},\) \(\phi_1, ..., \phi_p]\) index_g: B-spline coefficients g(u) function index_beta: Single index coefficients \([\beta_m, \beta_{\dot{m}}, \beta_X, \beta_t]\) config Spline configurations: baseline: Config baseline hazard B-splines index: Config single index model B-splines initial Initial conditions \([\Lambda(0), m(0), \dot{m}(0)]\). Default c(0, 0, 0).

title: Solve Joint ODE System — .solve_joint_ode
text: list containing ODE solution components: cum_hazard Cumulative hazard \(\Lambda(T)\) event time (without exp(b)) log_hazard Log-hazard \(\log(\lambda(T))\) event time (WITHOUT b term) biomarker Vector biomarker values \(m(t)\) observation times (WITHOUT b shift). NULL longitudinal observations exist.

title: Solve Joint ODE System — .solve_joint_ode
text: ODE system : $$   \frac{d}{dt}\begin{pmatrix}\Lambda \\ m \\ \dot{m}\end{pmatrix} =   \begin{pmatrix}     \lambda(t) \\     \dot{m} \\     g(\beta^T Z)   \end{pmatrix} $$ : \(\Lambda(t)\) cumulative hazard function \(m(t)\) biomarker trajectory \(\dot{m}(t)\) biomarker velocity (first derivative) \(\lambda(t) = \exp[\eta^T B_\lambda(t) + \alpha_m m(t) +\) \(\alpha_{\dot{m}} \dot{m}(t) + \alpha_{\ddot{m}} \ddot{m}(t) +\) \(W^T\phi]\) hazard function \(g(u) = \theta^T B_g(u)\) flexible acceleration function \(u = \beta^T Z\) single index \(Z = [m, \dot{m}, X_{long}, t]\) \(B_\lambda(t)\) \(B_g(u)\) B-spline basis functions random effect \(b_i\) represents subject-specific deviation excluded ODE computational efficiency. incorporate \(b_i\): Actual log-hazard: log_hazard + b Actual cumulative hazard: Lambda * exp(b) Actual biomarker likelihood: biomarker + b separation mathematically valid \(b_i\) enters additive constant log-hazard, yielding: \(\Lambda(t|b) = e^b \Lambda(t|0)\). ODE solver uses adaptive step size control (LSODA method) numerical stability.

title: Solve Joint ODE System — .solve_joint_ode
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example: Solve ODE for a subject params <- list(   data = subject_data,  # Subject-specific data   coef = list(     baseline = c(0.1, 0.2, 0.15),     # Baseline hazard spline coefficients     hazard = c(0.3, 0.1, 0.05, 0.2),  # Hazard coefficients     index_g = c(0.5, 0.3, 0.2),       # Acceleration function coefficients     index_beta = c(0.4, 0.2, 0.1, 0.15) # Single index coefficients   ),   config = list(     baseline = baseline_spline_config,     index = index_spline_config   ) )  # Solve the ODE system sol <- .solve_joint_ode(params)  # Incorporate random effect b_i = 0.5 b <- 0.5 actual_log_hazard <- sol$log_hazard + b actual_cum_hazard <- sol$cum_hazard * exp(b) predicted_biomarker <- sol$biomarker + b  # Add b to biomarker values } # }

text: list containing: longitudinal_data Data frame longitudinal measurements: id: Subject identifier time: Measurement time v: Observed biomarker value (latent + random effect + error) x1: Time-varying covariate 1 (treatment decay: \(e^{-t/5}\)) x2: Time-varying covariate 2 (seasonal: \(0.2\sin(2\pi t)\)) survival_data Data frame survival outcomes: id: Subject identifier time: Observed event/censoring time status: Event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored) w1: Baseline continuous covariate ~ N(0,1) w2: Baseline binary covariate ~ Bernoulli(0.5)

title: Simulate Joint ODE Model Data — simulate
text: Model Framework simulation implements joint model two coupled components: 1. Longitudinal Model Biomarker evolution follows second-order nonlinear ODE: $$\ddot{m}_i(t) = g(\boldsymbol{\beta}^T \mathbf{Z}_i(t))$$ : \(m_i(t)\) latent biomarker trajectory subject \(\) \(\mathbf{Z}_i(t) = [m_i(t), \dot{m}_i(t), X_1(t), X_2(t), t]^T\) augmented state vector \(g(u) = 0.5 \tanh(u/3)\) bounded nonlinear link function ensuring stability \(\boldsymbol{\beta}\) controls dynamics (feedback, damping, covariate effects) Observed measurements incorporate random effects error: $$V_{ij} = m_i(T_{ij}) + b_i + \varepsilon_{ij}$$ \(b_i \sim N(0, \sigma_b^2)\) \(\varepsilon_{ij} \sim N(0, \sigma_e^2)\). 2. Survival Model hazard function links trajectory dynamics event risk: $$\lambda_i(t|b_i) = \lambda_0(t) \exp[\boldsymbol{\alpha}^T   \mathbf{m}_i(t) + \mathbf{W}_i^T \boldsymbol{\phi} + b_i]$$ : \(\lambda_0(t) = (\kappa/\theta)(t/\theta)^{\kappa-1}\) Weibull baseline hazard \(\mathbf{m}_i(t) = [m_i(t), \dot{m}_i(t), \ddot{m}_i(t)]^T\) captures trajectory features \(\mathbf{W}_i\) baseline covariates \(b_i\) shared random effect linking models Simulation Process ODE Integration: Solve second-order ODE system subject using adaptive LSODA algorithm Survival Generation: Sample event times conditional hazard using simsurv package Censoring: Apply administrative censoring uniformly 50th 95th percentiles event times Longitudinal Sampling: Generate visit schedules (quarterly years 0-2, semi-annual thereafter) 10% random missingness Parameter Interpretation ODE parameters (beta): beta[1]: Negative feedback (homeostasis), typically < 0 beta[2]: Damping coefficient (stability), typically < 0 beta[3-5]: Covariate time effects Association (alpha): alpha[1]: Current value association (typically > 0 risk biomarkers) alpha[2]: Rate change association alpha[3]: Acceleration association (often < 0 stability)
